Class HttpRequestValues.Builder

java.lang.Object
org.springframework.web.service.invoker.HttpRequestValues.Builder
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpRequestValues.Metadata
Direct Known Subclasses:
ReactiveHttpRequestValues.Builder
Enclosing class:
HttpRequestValues
public static class HttpRequestValues.Builder extends Object implements HttpRequestValues.Metadata
Builder for HttpRequestValues.
Since:
6.0
Author:
Rossen Stoyanchev, Olga Maciaszek-Sharma

  • Method Details

    • setHttpMethod

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setHttpMethod(HttpMethod httpMethod)
      Set the HTTP method for the request.

    • setUri

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setUri(URI uri)
      Set the URL to use. When set, this overrides the URI template from the HttpExchange annotation.

    • setUriBuilderFactory

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setUriBuilderFactory(@Nullable UriBuilderFactory uriBuilderFactory)
      Set the UriBuilderFactory that will be used to expand the getUriTemplate().
      Since:
      6.1

    • setUriTemplate

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setUriTemplate(String uriTemplate)
      Set the request URL as a String template.

    • setUriVariable

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setUriVariable(String name, String value)
      Add a URI variable name-value pair.

    • setAccept

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setAccept(List<MediaType> acceptableMediaTypes)
      Set the media types for the request Accept header.

    • setContentType

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setContentType(MediaType contentType)
      Set the media type for the request Content-Type header.

    • addHeader

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder addHeader(String headerName, String... headerValues)
      Add the given header name and values.

    • configureHeaders

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder configureHeaders(Consumer<HttpHeaders> consumer)
      Provide access to every header configured so far with the option to add, replace, or remove values.
      Since:
      7.0

    • addCookie

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder addCookie(String name, String... values)
      Add the given cookie name and values.

    • configureCookies

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder configureCookies(Consumer<MultiValueMap<String,String>> consumer)
      Provide access to every cookie configured so far with the option to add, replace, or remove values.
      Since:
      7.0

    • addRequestParameter

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder addRequestParameter(String name, String... values)
      Add the given request parameter name and values.

      When "content-type" is set to "application/x-www-form-urlencoded", request parameters are encoded in the request body. Otherwise, they are added as URL query parameters.

    • configureRequestParams

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder configureRequestParams(Consumer<MultiValueMap<String,String>> consumer)
      Provide access to every request parameter configured so far with the option to add, replace, or remove values.
      Since:
      7.0

    • addRequestPart

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder addRequestPart(String name, Object part)
      Add a part for a multipart request. The part may be:
      • String -- form field
      • Resource -- file part
      • Object -- content to be encoded (for example, to JSON)
      • HttpEntity -- part content and headers although generally it's easier to add headers through the returned builder

    • setApiVersion

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder setApiVersion(Object version)
      Set an API version for the request. The version is passed on to the underlying RestClient or WebClient that in turn are configured with an ApiVersionInserter.
      Parameters:
      version - the API version of the request; this can be a String or some Object that can be formatted the inserter, e.g. through an ApiVersionFormatter.
      Since:
      7.0

    • addAttribute

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder addAttribute(String name, Object value)
      Configure an attribute to associate with the request.
      Parameters:
      name - the attribute name
      value - the attribute value

    • configureAttributes

      public HttpRequestValues.Builder configureAttributes(Consumer<Map<String,Object>> consumer)
      Provide access to every attribute configured so far with the option to add, replace, or remove values.
      Since:
      7.0

    • setBodyValue

      public void setBodyValue(@Nullable Object bodyValue)
      Set the request body as an Object to be serialized.

    • setBodyValue

      public void setBodyValue(@Nullable Object bodyValue, @Nullable ParameterizedTypeReference<?> valueType)
      Variant of setBodyValue(Object) with the body type.
